result.execSummary:
The defendant Eli J Edwards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).
  • Attempt 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).
  • Mayhem [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.21.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 60 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

No contact with the victims (person, property, residence or family).  Further education while incarcerated.  No weapons.q  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent including psych evaluation and anger management. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

AMENDED TO ADD RESTITUTION PER RESTITUTION HEARING HELD 07-19-2018

It is the court's intention that the Department of Corrections can take 25% from all money received for the benefit of the inmate while he is incarcerated to be applied to restitution owing to the victim.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order affirming

records.addlTxt: IT IS ORDERED that the petition for review is denied, without costs.

IT IS ORDERED that the court grants permission to proceed without payment of the filing fee. This order waives only the filing fees in the Supreme Court. It is not a determination of indigency for any other purpose. Indigency may be reevaluated if a request is received for waiver of other fees based on indigency.
Petition for Review

IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of conviction is affirmed pursuant to WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Marcella De Peters is relieved of any further representation of Eli J. Edwards in this matter. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3).

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victims (person, property, residence or family).   Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.   You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
